result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara M Towne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant appears in court, in custody, with Attorney Penn.  DA Karl Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Counts 1 and 2: Plea of guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. court imposes 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System; 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. - STAYED.  2 years probation ordered with conditions: Court costs on each count, AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent, Obtain a mental health assessment and follow through with any recommendations, Maintain absolute sobriety, Obtain gainful employment.  Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.

11:21 .  Defendant Sara M Towne in custody in court.  Attorney David Vernon Penn not in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. State spoke with Atty. David Penn earlier this morning regarding offer.  Additional PTC requested by defense. Bond continued

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sara M Towne appeared by video.  Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Sara M Towne.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre trial for June 14th at 11:15 am.

Defendant Sara M Towne appeared by video, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is public defender eligible and they are making efforts to find counsel. Court adjourns initial appearance for March 14th at 9:45 am. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  She has not had the opportunity to contact the public defender's office.  Court advised her to do so.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled February 28, 2021 at 9:15 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets $5000.00 cash bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. Court sets initial appearance to February 21st at 1:00pm.
